attributes.action: end the postcode lottery for IVF funding and to ensure that current NICE guidelines for IVF funding are adhered to by all PCT’s in the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
NICE clearly state in their guidelines for fertility;

“Couples in which the woman is aged 23–39 years at the time of treatment and who have an identified cause for their fertility problems (such as azoospermia or bilateral tubal occlusion) or who have infertility of at least 3 years’ duration should be offered up to three stimulated cycles of in vitro fertilization treatment.”

Unfortunately, many PCT’s don’t adhere to this, leaving couples facing a tough financial commitment or a bleak possibility of having to wait until they are old enough to meet the PCT’s criteria.

Please note: Waiting for treatment reduces a women’s fertility rate.

It seems that funding for IVF is not given on the basis of fairness, but on where you live. 

For example, in Coventry, your local PCT will follow NICE guidelines, however in Oxford your PCT use their own rules making you wait until 35. At this age success per cycle drops to 23.6% (HFEA).

This is unacceptable as National Health Insurance is not dependant on where you live, so why should healthcare be?
